text:
Warren Francisco Plunkett (August 4, 1920 – December 30, 2018) was a former American football player and judge. He played as a blocking back on one season with the Cleveland Rams of the National Football League in 1942. He played college football at the University of Minnesota. He was born in St. Paul, Minnesota.
Plunkett died of complications from pneumonia in Austin, Minnesota on December 30, 2018 at the age of 98.
